text: there's been times in the past I wake up
in the morning where I'm like I just
wish I could just put on the same outfit
as yesterday and not have to think about
it and now I think I'm absolutely just
going to put on the same outfit as
yesterday because it really doesn't
matter so this week for Thursday Styles
we took a look at a number of people
around the world who were trying to cut
back on the amount of clothing that they
buy they're taking part in what are
known as shopping diets where they're
challenging one another to either not
buy clothes for an entire year or to
wear just six items out of their closet
for an entire month I co-founded the
project six items or less with my friend
Tamsin Tamsin had emailed me and asked
me if I wanted to wear one outfit for an
entire year and I was like no I couldn't
do that but I was I told her that I was
willing to explore an experiment in
restricting clothing and that's really
where the idea was born she and her
friend put together a website and they
were surprised just how many people
volunteered to do this almost a hundred
so both of us are really interested in
if you don't think about what you wear
even if you have 20 blank 20 black tank
tops and that's what you wear every day
does that free up your mind and your
creativity in other ways if you don't
think about clothing so she and I came
in from a very strong uniform route and
that was actually the minority of the
participants because when people were
signing up we would ask them why you
were doing this and we realized it fell
into four camps the four camps were
uniform creativity because we don't
limit accessories so some people want to
see like how creative they can be with
their stuff anti consumption was our
biggest group and then what we call
curiosity slash masochism which a lot of
the guys fall into where they're like I
just wonder if I can do it and if it's
gonna drive me crazy
by doing this experiment of course
there's the economy people are worried
about spending too much right now but
also there's a concern for the
environment when you look at all the
fast fashion chains that are out there
and the number of options people have
it's kind of overwhelming how many
clothes are available to people and also
in their own closets
so I wear mostly black anyway I didn't
think this experiment was going to be
too difficult for me because I already
am pretty tight in my clothing choices
so I picked the black jeggings because
they're light and I knew it was gonna be
warm black tank top I'm a huge tank top
person so I knew I had to have one of
those black blazer I work in a corporate
environment
I'm corporate clients I have to go to
meetings and then the other three are my
summer savers like help me Lord in the
New York heat a pair of cutoff shorts
like I could kind of slum around with in
the weekend but also dress up if I
needed to a grey skirt and then a black
dress which I got really sick of in the
end one of the things that was really
surprising among all the people I spoke
to was just how few people even noticed
what they were doing I've had people
come to me on week three say are you
doing that and I work with them and I
sit next to them every day and I'm like
I've learned the same outfit four days
in a row it's a very small number of
people who are doing this about 250
around the world but they've really
touched a hot-button issue here in terms
of how people relate to their closets so
what they really exposed is just how
much concern there is among people about
what they're spending on clothes and
what they're getting for it and I think
what you probably will see as a result
of these types of diets it's that people
are going to be more conscious about how
they buy their clothes that idea of
having those staple pieces in your
wardrobe that lasts forever that's
become so much more valuable to me after
going through this the idea that I could
wear a pair of trousers for 15 years I
just loved the idea of the accessories
making the outfit as opposed to having
to change the outfit all the time to
make a statement I'm a little excited
honest I know this probably the worst
thing to say it's just my clothes are
wearing out and clothes just aren't
built to be worn the way that we've been
wearing them which i think is a really
interesting lesson for people that make
clothes
